issue.title: Query::select removes fields if it passed twice

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
After updating from 2.0.13 to 2.0.14 i have noticed some strange behavior of `Query::select()`.
If you reassign select fields, duplicates will be removed like in example below:

### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```        
$query = (new yii\db\Query())
            ->select('id')
            ->from('place')
        ;
$query->select(['id', 'brand_id']);
return $query->one();
```

### What is the expected result?
```
[
'id' => 1,
'brand_id' => 1,
]
```

### What do you get instead?
```
[
'brand_id' => 1,
]
```

### Additional info

**Notice**: if define `id` inside `select` with alias in first __or__ second definition (i.e `['id_alias' => 'id']`), it will be ok and `id` will be selected.

It seems that such behavior occurs because of `Query::getUniqueColumns()`, added in 2.0.14.

Maybe related with: #15674


| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.14
| PHP version      |  7.1.14
| DB | mysql 5.7

labels.name: severity:BC breaking
labels.description: Either breaks backwards compatibility or fixed previously made breakage

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.title: getUniqueColumns unset any columns if passed same array

labels.name: severity:BC breaking
labels.description: Either breaks backwards compatibility or fixed previously made breakage

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
```php
 $q = (new Query())
            ->select([
                'total_sum' => 'SUM(f.amount)',
                'in_sum' => 'SUM(IF(f.type = :type_in, f.amount, 0))',
                'out_sum' => 'SUM(IF(f.type = :type_out, f.amount, 0))',
                'partner_out_sum' => 'SUM(IF(a.type = :type_partner AND f.type = :type_out, f.amount, 0))',
                'count_in' => 'COUNT(IF(f.type = :type_in, 1, NULL))',
                'count_out' => 'COUNT(IF(f.type = :type_out, 1, NULL))',
                'cnt_total' => 'COUNT(1)',
                'day_group' => 'TO_DAYS(f.updated)',
                'timestamp' => 'UNIX_TIMESTAMP(FROM_DAYS(TO_DAYS(f.updated)))',
            ])->addParams([
                ':type_in' => Finance::TYPE_IN,
                ':type_out' => Finance::TYPE_OUT,
                ':type_partner' => Account::TYPE_PARTNER,
            ]);
        $select = $q->select;
        $q->select($select);
        print_r($q->select);
```
### What is the expected result?
```php
           [
                'total_sum' => 'SUM(f.amount)',
                'in_sum' => 'SUM(IF(f.type = :type_in, f.amount, 0))',
                'out_sum' => 'SUM(IF(f.type = :type_out, f.amount, 0))',
                'partner_out_sum' => 'SUM(IF(a.type = :type_partner AND f.type = :type_out, f.amount, 0))',
                'count_in' => 'COUNT(IF(f.type = :type_in, 1, NULL))',
                'count_out' => 'COUNT(IF(f.type = :type_out, 1, NULL))',
                'cnt_total' => 'COUNT(1)',
                'day_group' => 'TO_DAYS(f.updated)',
                'timestamp' => 'UNIX_TIMESTAMP(FROM_DAYS(TO_DAYS(f.updated)))',
            ]
```
### What do you get instead?
`[]`

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.14?
| PHP version      | 7.1
| Operating system | Linux

body: fix is worked, but i find another bug

issue.title: select() on existing ActiveQuery() returns random values

labels.name: severity:BC breaking
labels.description: Either breaks backwards compatibility or fixed previously made breakage

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### Example One
    $queryBase = Account::find()
           ->select(['one'=>'id', 'two'=>'name, 'three'=>'number'])
           ->where(['active'=1, 'archived'=0]);
    $queryData = $queryBase->select(['one'='number', 'two'=>'id']);
    $data = $queryData->createCommand()->queryAll();

### Result One
Expected : array generated from `SELECT number as one, id as two FROM ...`
Actual result : array generated from `SELECT * FROM ...`

### Example Two
    $queryBase = Account::find()
           ->select(['one'=>'a.id', 'two'=>'a.name, 'three'=>'a.number'])
           ->from(['a'=>Account::tableName()])
           ->innerJoin(['b'=>State::tableName()], 'a.state_id=b.id')
           ->where(['active'=1, 'archived'=0]);
    $queryData = $queryBase->select(['one'='a.name', 'two'=>'b.name']);
    $data = $queryData->createCommand()->queryAll();

### Result One
Expected : array generated from `SELECT a.name as one, b.name as two FROM ...`
Actual result : array generated from `SELECT b.name as two FROM ...`

### Additional info
It appears there is a problem with forming the "select" sub-array in the query object.

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.14
| PHP version      |  7.0.25
| Operating system | ubuntu 16.04.1
